column2: Jasper1930, 75 or over Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Been on this MED for a little more than 2 yrs.Taking 10 Mgs once each day in morning.Have had good results. Blood pressure is normal for one my age. No side effects yet.

column2: mexiletine, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Every day I was on this pill I got worse and thought I was dieing.  No food sounded good got sick to stomach, couldn't get food down and started loosing weight. lost 14 lbs in 2 weeks.Now I'm off it and feeling better every day.

column2: millie, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: suffered bad heartburn. Bad chest pain. Had difficult when eating. Felt like food gets stuck in my chest. Couldn't eat because of pain. Stopped twice. Feel much better after stopping.

column2: dodgeracer43@aol.com, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Been on the drug for about two months. Started off at 150mg.X 3 daily had to be upped to 250 mg.x 3 daily seems to be doing its job now. Still go into Vtech every now and then very small attacks. So far happy with drug.

column2: rowatt, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I've had rapid and/or irregular heart rate since childhood. Was particularly sensitive to caffeine too.  Six months ago I began experiencing severe irregular heart rhythmns, sometimes feeling two or three beats together which would go on for a while. Almost fainted once.A specialist MD, an electrophysiologist started me on Mexiletine, 150mg twice each day with fantastic results. My heart  almost immediately returned to a  stable pulse. Only side effect is heartburn if I forget to eat or drink milk when taking the pill.

column2: Fernrose, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have had severe burning down my left leg for 22 years. I have had 6 back surgeries; thinking each time it would help this along with my other back problems. Nothing has helped as much as seeing a pain doctor and he prescribed Mexiletine along with another new drug and increasing 2 others. I am finally so I can live with the burning.

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
phildo, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: have dialated cardiomyopathy, atrial fibrilation and an ICD.  my ICD went off (3x) and the increased my dose (3x).  been stable for awhile.  the next drug to try is scary.

column2: Cakoo1, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Since taking this medication, I feel that itis controling my sustained v-tach, however, I have bad nervous shakes in my hands making it hard to hod something without my hands shaking. I will report this to my doctor in the AM as I have an appointment.

column2: 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
granny, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I had problems with irr.heart beat and tachicardia most of my life.I along with my sister had muscle cramps and stiffness that caused many problems and very embarassing.As we become older the problems became worse. I began to fall alot and even had difficulty turning over in bed. During my pregnancies the muscle spasams were so bad it was not safe to drive due to inability to respond. I could not turn my head without a severe muscle cramps.  We  have been DX Mytonia Congentia and perscribed Mexatil 150mg. I have had only 2 episides of tachicardia in the past 5 years since I began taking Mexatil 150mg BID.And the ability to walk across a room without apearing as someone needing a wheelchair is wonderful.

column2: Linda, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: My doctor prescribed this for Migraine treatment.  After a few months I noticed many side effects: Shaky hands, blurred vision, muscle cramps and trouble speaking.  I gradually tapered off Mexiletine.  It took a long time for my vision to improve.

column2: runing, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column9: For my sever arithmia I take one pill in the morning200mg and one pill 200mg in the evening. I have had no side effects that I am aware of. Although I also take 2 pills of amiodarone, I have had no shocks from my defribulator lately.
